availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Walker Hicks and Susan Hicks. Employed by William Setzer as a farmer in Hardin County in 1850. Grocer and liquor store owner in Hardin County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Southern District, p. 401B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Stephensburg, p. 403A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 4th Congressional District, Hardin County, Vol. 1 of 3, n.d., p. 200, p. 237 of 317 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on October 15, 2020).
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Hardin County Wills, 1866-1915; Vol F-G,(Accessed through ancestry.com on April 29, 2020), p. 131 of microfilm.
KYR-0001-004-0376.
